author: axic3354
content: Yes, we need help with the actual implementation. We do plan to work further on the synthetic loop option, but that is only an approximation. Thought about code golfing as an idea, but at this point the work is of bigger scope. Golfing would be appropriate to motivate optimisations on a base implementation.

author: djrtwo
content:
does 2537 need golf/optimizations.
Shouldn't this run at native speeds?

author: Deleted User
content: no, EIP-2537 does not need golfing. But re-implementation of it in EVM code (with EVM384 opcodes) could use some. Though I now agree with <@!425279588009246720> that it would be best to have a first implementation before golfing

author: djrtwo
content: ah, I misunderstood your original statement. got it
